intro: Sebastiania multiramea var. luschnathiana, commonly known as the Luschnathia sebastiania, is a species of flowering plant in the family Euphorbiaceae. It is characterized by its small, bright yellow flowers that are clustered in dense inflorescences. The plant typically grows as a shrub with woody stems and alternate, elliptic-shaped leaves. It is native to the tropical regions of Central and South America. The species is often cultivated for its ornamental value due to its vibrant floral display.
